AVSEC Order No. 05 /2011 
Subject:- 
Designation of Security Co-ordinator at each airport served by civil 
flights in India and responsibility thereof. 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 
1797 dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), for the purpose of 
securing the aircraft operations and access control at the  civil  airports in India directs 
that: 
 
(i) 
The Chief Executive  Officer of  Indian Nationality  at each Greenfield 
Indian Airport  and Airport  Director or  Incharge Airport  Management at AAI 
Airports  which are served by civil flights shall be Security Co-ordinator at the 
respective airports and  shall be  responsible for coordinating the implementation 
of security measures in accordance with the legal provisions and instructions 
issued by the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security from time to time. 
 
(ii) 
The  Security Co-ordinator shall  designate a Chief Security Officer (CSO) 
responsible for security oversight.  The CSO shall be bestowed  upon the powers 
which shall  encompass all security controls at the airport level for which the 
Security Co-ordinator is responsible for coordinating. 
 
 
 
(iii) 
The CSO at  the concerned airport  shall  establish a process for  
resolution of deficiencies or concerns identified in the security tasks delegated  to 
the  Airport  Operator  and other entities at the airport level. Necessary action 
shall be taken to rectify the deficiencies  or concerns and shall  submit the report  
to the  Security Coordinator for  further  action,  if any,  and communication to the  
COS(CA). 
 
2. 
This AVSEC Order supercedes AVSEC Order  No.3/2000, dated 27.5.2000. 
 
3. 
Any violation of  this  AVSEC  Order  shall attract penalty under Section 11A of 
the Aircraft Act, 1934.
